text.0: come radiant aśvins with your noble horses accept your servants hymns ye wonderworkers.
text.1: enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.
text.2: the gladdening juices stand prepared before you come quickly and partake of mine oblation.
text.3: pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.
text.4: your chariot with a hundred aids o aśvins beareth you swift as thought across the regions.
text.5: speeding to us o ye whose wealth is sūrya.
text.6: what time this stone of yours the gods adorer upraised sounds forth for you as somapresser.
text.7: let the priest bring you fair ones through oblations.
text.8: the nourishment ye have is truly wondrous ye gave thereof a quickening store to atri.
text.9: who being dear to you receives your favour.
text.10: that gift which all may gain ye gave cyavāna when he grew old who offered you oblations.
text.11: when ye bestowed on him enduring beauty.
text.12: what time his wicked friends abandoned bhujyu o aśvins in the middle of the ocean.
text.13: your horse delivered him your faithful servant.
text.14: ye lent your aid to vrka when exhausted and listened when invoked to Śayus calling.
text.15: ye made the cow pour forth her milk like water and aśvins strengthened with your strength the barren.
text.16: with his fair hymns this singer too extols you waking with glad thoughts at the break of morning.
text.17: may the cow nourish him with milk to feed llim preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
